definition: fake/impostor/quack (doctor)/imitation brand
surname Mao
to emit/to give off/to send out (or up, forth)/to brave/to face/reckless/to falsely adopt (sb's identity etc)/to feign/(literary) to cover
mahjong tile/playing card/game pieces/signboard/plate/tablet/medal/CL:片[pian4],個|个[ge4],塊|块[kuai4]
fake goods/imitation/forgery

sentences.english: In What Ways are the Duke and the Dauphin Different from Tom?
sentences.chinese: 冒牌公爵和假皇太子與湯姆有何不同？

sentences.english: He succeeded in his profession, but he always secretly considered himself an impostor.
sentences.chinese: 他在專業方面很成功，但他常暗自認爲是個冒牌貨。

sentences.english: Fake-brand Jeans are a big business in many places.
sentences.chinese: 冒牌牛仔服在許多地方都生意興隆。

sentences.english: He dismissed her work as that of a mere versifier.
sentences.chinese: 他把她的作品貶爲一個冒牌詩人所作。

sentences.english: eg: The phony managed to slide over the questions which were difficult for him to answer.
sentences.chinese: 那個冒牌貨設法避開了那些他難回答的問題。

sentences.english: These sheets I've bought are a cheat, they are too short for the bed.
sentences.chinese: 那些我買的牀單是冒牌貨，它們鋪在牀上太短。

sentences.english: Job of staff of a few pinchbeck remove furniture is coarse, throw bad furniture electric equipment.
sentences.chinese: 一些冒牌搬場人員工作粗糙，摔壞傢俱電器。

sentences.english: We are tempted to buy a fake bag and fashion our own Louis Vuitton plasters.
sentences.chinese: 我們想買一隻冒牌包來當作自己的路易威登。

sentences.english: Buy a brand to prevent " pinchbeck " .
But the majority of designer products sold in Iran are fake.
sentences.chinese: 不過，那裏賣的設計師品牌，絕大多數都是冒牌貨。

sentences.english: He is a pretender to philosophy.
Before these bastard signs of fair were born.
sentences.chinese: 那時冒牌的豔色還未曾出世。

sentences.english: That doesn’t mean that your whole life has been a fraud (see: how to not sell out).
sentences.chinese: 但也不意味着你整個人生就是個冒牌貨。

definition: fake goods/imitation/forgery
to impersonate/to pose as (someone else)/to counterfeit/to palm off (a fake as a genuine)
cheap quality counterfeit (goods)/low-quality commodities
genuine goods at fair prices/(fig.) genuine/real/true
to counterfeit/fake
ruthless and lacking in conscience/vicious mind full of hatred and jealousy/black core (flaw in pottery)
to feign/to pretend to be/to pass oneself off as
replacement guaranteed if not genuine/fig. authentic
unscrupulous businessman/profiteer/shark/dishonest business
unidentified origin/no-one knows where it comes from/of dubious background
lit. to steal a rafter and replace it with a column/to replace the original with a fake/to perpetrate a fraud (idiom)
bogus/ersatz/fake/mock/phoney
inferior brand/not the genuine article
to pass off fish eyes for pearls/to pass off fake products as genuine (idiom)
lit. to hang a sheep's head while selling dog meat (idiom)/fig. to cheat/dishonest advertising/wicked deeds carried out under banner of virtue
pinyin: gua4 yang2 tou2 mai4 gou3 rou4

definition: to impersonate/to act the part of sb/to disguise oneself as sb else
